column4: hey i am using the gutsy gibbon RC and was wondering why i am not receiving any updates. previously, when i ran the RC of feisty fawn i received updates even after the release
try "sudo apt-get update; sudo apt-get dist-upgrade"
oh ok, a dist upgrade
i tried the dist-upgrade and have the same thing by the way...    it is possible there were no updates since the release candidate?
no, i'm pretty sure there *were* updates from the RC... not from the latest dailies, but from the RC, yes. pastebin your /etc/apt/sources.list
ok, i havent had any updates since i installed it about 4-5 days ago. here is the sources.list: http://pastebin.ca/744468
4-5 days ago? then it might have been a later version than the actual RC. are you sure it was the RC and you didn't get any "immediate" updates when you installed?
sources.list seems ok
i got some immediate updates.. but it was just after RC was released (maybe the next day)
give me the output of     apt-cache policy tzdata     (that package was updated recently)
jessie^^: the amount of used RAM, as seen in "top" or "free", doesn't mean much of anything.
apt-cache policy tzdata  gives me 2007f-3ubuntu1 for Candidate and Installed
uhm, there is 2007h-0ubuntu0.7.10 in gutsy-updates
so im missing something?
*i* am missing something, for sure. your sources.list has gutsy-updates enabled, and yet you aren't getting those updates.
try temporarily removing the "au." from your mirrors... perhaps the australian mirrors are having problems?
remove also the first line (the CD line), you won't probably need that and it will just be a nuisance
hang on, im getting a tonne of 'Ign[ored]' when updating.. ill pastebin
yes, thanks
i use KDE... highlight and middle click *should* work though
yeah it works in KDE. not working here in gnome :(
ill just pipe to a file and then upload it
uhm there are some igns but i'm not sure that should be an issue itself
